nodes.text: The Hall of Heroes was an underground hall carved out of solid rock by the X'Ting of Ord Cestus. Constructed in honor of those ancient X'Ting who had contributed the most to their history, the warriors who helped defeat the Spider People were the most noted individuals represented in the Hall.

It was the Hall of Heroes which served as the primary entrance to the labyrinth protecting the royal eggs of the X'Ting. After the Great Plague, a group of X'Ting established a hive in the Hall in order to keep to the old ways and ensuring that the pathway to the royal eggs was well-guarded. Exterminated by carnivorous worms that served as the second security measure, these worms destroyed the X'Ting hive, leaving no information on the other security systems. Around one hundred fifty years before the Clone Wars, Jedi Master Yoda traveled to Ord Cestus and saved the native X'Ting from disaster, to which they honored Yoda by building a giant statue of him, at least 70 meters tall.
During the Clone Wars, Jedi Knight Obi-Wan Kenobi and his guide, Jesson Di Blinth, learned that the correct entrance went through the largest of the statues, that of Jedi Master Yoda.
